contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Thomas Inskip.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Thomas Inskip, 1st Viscount Caldecote]].]] '''Viscount Caldecote''', of Bristol in the County of Gloucester, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1939 for the lawyer and politician [[Thomas Inskip, 1st Viscount Caldecote|Sir Thomas Inskip]] so that he could sit in the [[House of Lords]] and serve as [[Lord Chancellor]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his grandson, the third Viscount, who succeeded his father in 1999. Lord Caldecote's elder half-brother the Right Reverend [[James Inskip]] was a clergyman while his younger brother Sir John Hampden Inskip (1879–1960) was Lord Mayor of Bristol in 1931. ==Viscounts Caldecote (1939)== *[[Thomas Inskip, 1st Viscount Caldecote|Thomas Walker Hobart Inskip, 1st Viscount Caldecote]] (1876–1947) *[[Robert Inskip, 2nd Viscount Caldecote|Robert Andrew Inskip, 2nd Viscount Caldecote]] (1917–1999) *Piers James Hampden Inskip, 3rd Viscount Caldecote (b. 1947) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son Hon. Thomas James Inskip (b. 1985) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} ==External links== *{{Hansard-contribs | mr-piers-inskip | Piers James Hampden Inskip, 3rd Viscount Caldecote }} {{British viscounts}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Caldecote}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
